title: Edinburgh: The panel take questions on the rental market, car free city centres, the Assisted Dying Bill, and economic growth
description: The SNP's Jim Fairlie, Scottish Labour's Michael Shanks, Scottish Conservatives' Sue Webber, journalist Gabriella Bennett and musician Colin MacIntyre join Stephen Jardine to discuss Edinburgh's rental market,

title: Humza Yousaf mocked as SNP campaign broadcast fails to mention Indy
description: Humza Yousaf has been criticised by fellow Yes supporters after the SNP’s new general election broadcast failed to mention independence.

title: Sturgeon transferred ‘zero’ WhatsApp Covid messages on to corporate record
description: The former first minister is now facing calls to make a personal statement to Holyrood to answer questions from MSPs.

title: Labour windfall tax hike 'could see 100,000 jobs lost'

title: Glasgow parking charges to rise but council tax frozen as budget set
description: A late deal between the SNP and the Greens was agreed as the city faces an almost £108m shortfall over three years - with concerns raised by Labour that it will see education funding cut.

title: All who sell their labour are working-class and should band together
description: ASSA Samake-Roman has very much missed the point about social class in her column in Wednesday’s National (UK’s definition of who

title: Edinburgh Castle cafe threatened with firebombs after nationalist backlash at Redcoat name
description: The Redcoat Cafe, which is named after British soldiers, was criticised on social media by figures including SNP politicians

title: Frustration over stalled plan for new Keith Health Centre
description: THE lack of progress towards a "desperately needed" and "top priority" new Keith Health Centre has been criticised.

title: Glasgow city council passes budget backing council tax freeze
description: GLASGOW’S local authority has passed its budget for the next three years, with councillors choosing to freeze council tax.

title: Glasgow holiday hunger programme to get extra £1.5m after row over Labour 'cut'
description: Glasgow City Council is to invest a further £1.5 million into its Holiday Food programme this financial year as part of its budget deal - after claims the Labour budget has scrapped it 'by mistake'.

title: Glasgow councillors pass budget backing council tax freeze
description: During the Glasgow council meeting city treasurer Ricky Bell, from the governing SNP group, said the council tax freeze was “fully funded”. Council leader Susan Aitken also backed the council tax freeze. She said: “We don’t have the powers in Scotland just now to address rampant inflation and mortgage rates.

title: ‘I’m a Waspi woman, cancer forced me out of work at 60 with no income’
description: Anne Andrews – who belongs to the so-called Waspi (women against state pension inequality) generation – revealed how she struggled financially after being forced to give up work while having gruelling medical treatment.

title: Parking charges and school meals to rise in Glasgow
description: The price of a school meal, parking charges and Glasgow Life facilities are to rise to meet cuts needed to balance the council’s budget.

title: Cole-Hamilton responds to fall in nursing applications for third year in a row
description: Responding to the embargoed data from UCAS which shows that for the third year in a row the number of applicants for nursing courses in Scotland has dropped, down by 8.3% compared to the same point last year,

title: SNP ‘running out of excuses’ as Sturgeon and co. recorded 0 Whatsapps

title: Nicola Sturgeon: Former first minister told to make statement on recording of Covid WhatsApps over 'zero' message retention
description: Opposition parties say the SNP government has ‘huge questions’ to answer about WhatsApp messages during the coronavirus pandemic

title: Rachel Reeves defends Labour vetting in anti-Semitism row
description: Shadow chancellor says Labour cannot ‘see everything everywhere’ as party is under pressure to tighten checks on parliamentary candidates

title: Sturgeon still faces questions over missing WhatsApps, say Labour
description: SCOTTISH LABOUR has attacked the SNP’s “culture of secrecy and cover-up,” as a row over missing messages related to its handling of the Covid pandemic continues.

title: Nicola Sturgeon under fire over new 'eye-opening' revelation on Covid WhatsApps
description: The former Scottish first minister is facing calls to make a personal statement to Holyrood about her failure to transfer WhatsApps onto official records.

title: NHS Lanarkshire facing massive £112m funding black hole
description: NHS Lanarkshire is facing a massive £112m black hole and huge cuts to plug the deficit. The amount the health board has to save is the equivalent of 24 days’ running costs for the struggling board. A leaked paper states: “All directors have been asked to consider how a five to six per cent reduction to their budget could be achieved.”

title: Plans to move public path at Perthshire estate narrowly approved by single vote
description: The new path will wrap around the back of the approved driving range buildings, raising concerns about the safety of horse riders who regularly use the current bridleway

title: Scottish NHS in ‘desperate situation’ as staffing crisis worsens
description: Scottish Labour’s Jackie Baillie said: “These figures are a damning reminder of how damaged the perception of nursing in Scotland has become under the SNP’s watch. “Years of seeing our NHS with an understaffed, overstretched nursing workforce has ...

title: Councils vote to freeze tax rates
description: Glasgow City Council and North Lanarkshire Council have voted to freeze council tax for the coming year. The budgets were approved after councillors at the respective local authorities met to discuss budgets for the next three years. Other councils will discuss their budgets in the coming weeks, with some actively considering council tax rises.

title: Labour ‘would have acted sooner’ had it known about Ali’s comments, says Reeves
description: The shadow chancellor said party leader Sir Keir Starmer had intervened ‘swiftly’ to ‘ensure the highest standards’.

title: Nothing Changes Here
description: One year ago today, Nicola Sturgeon suddenly resigned as First Minister. And what a spectacular 12 months it’s been for the Yes movement since her departure. That, of course, is a somewhat

title: A year on - what is Nicola Sturgeon's legacy?
description: There is no denying Nicola Sturgeon made the SNP the force in Scottish politics, the establishment party. She was a force to be reckoned with but her leaving has seen her party falter and her apparent refusal to listen to a wider group of advisers while in charge saw policy misjudgements which proved hugely divisive across Scottish society.
